name: Gaeng Panang Gai (Thai Panang Chicken Curry)
description: This gaeng panang gai is easy to make for any home cook. Serve with jasmine rice for a complete meal.
recipeIngredient: 3  kaffir lime leaves (stems removed, cut into thin strips)

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce half of the coconut milk in your wok or pot over medium heat until it’s thick and oil begins to separate.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce half of the coconut milk in your wok or pot over medium heat until it’s thick and oil begins to separate.

recipeInstructions.text: Add panang curry paste and stir well until the coconut milk is fully infused with the spices.
recipeInstructions.name: Add panang curry paste and stir well until the coconut milk is fully infused with the spices.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the remaining coconut milk, chicken, and pea eggplants along with sauces and seasonings – palm sugar, fish sauce, and salt. Let the curry simmer for 3–5 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the remaining coconut milk, chicken, and pea eggplants along with sauces and seasonings – palm sugar, fish sauce, and salt. Let the curry simmer for 3–5 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Lastly, turn off the heat and add kaffir lime leaves strips and sliced chilies. Serve immediately with rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Lastly, turn off the heat and add kaffir lime leaves strips and sliced chilies. Serve immediately with rice.

review.reviewBody: I love how detailed these recipes are. They are very flavorful and everyone I have tried has been a hit.

keywords: chicken panang, gaeng panang, panang chicken, panang gai, thai curry
